author: Pavan Dahat
text:
A group of people shouting “Jai Shree Ram” allegedly attacked a church in Khamardih area of Chhattisgarh’s capital Raipur on Sunday.

According to an eyewitness, the group with some persons wielding sticks and hockey sticks entered the church when the Sunday prayer service was underway. “Some 30 to 35 people barged in and started damaging fans and chairs.

They abused people offering prayers and even attacked kids and nuns,” said a woman who was present in the church.

It was not clear to which group the attackers belonged. However, Chhattisgarh Christian Forum president Arun Pannalal blamed the Bajrang Dal.

He said six women were injured in the attack.

According to some reports, the miscreants raised “threatening slogans”, demanding an end to illegal conversions.

Three arrested

Raipur police registered an FIR and arrested three people on Sunday evening.

“Search is on for the other culprits,” said Raipur Additional Superintendent of Police Neeraj Chandrakar.

Official sources said the attack appeared to be the handiwork of the Shree Ram Sene. However, they refused to say anything “on record.”
title: 6 women hurt in attack on Chhattisgarh church
